choices.C: Set the service parameter Party Entrance Tone to "True."
choices.D: Configure the service parameter hunt group logoff notification and specify the name of the ringtone file.
choices.A: Configure the HLog softkey on the phone so that while a user is logged off, it plays an audible tone when a call is missed.
choices.B: Set the service parameter Enterprise Feature Access number for hunt group logout and set up an access number.

questions.question_text: A company has users that are logged in to hunt groups. However, there is a requirement for hunt group configurations to provide an option to turn on audible ringtones when calls to a line group arrive at a phone that is logged out and on a break. This ringtone alerts a logged-out user that there is an incoming call to a hunt list to which the line is a member, but the call does not ring at the phone of that line group member because of the logged-out status. Which action meets this requirement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
The Hunt Group Logoff Notification service parameter provides the option to turn audible ringtones on or off when calls that come in to a line group arrive at a phone that is currently logged out. This ringtone alerts a logged-out user that there is an incoming call to a hunt list to which the line is a member, but the call will not ring at the phone of that line group member because of the logged-out status. 

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/admin/10_5_2/ccmfeat/CUCM_BK_C3A84B33_00_cucm-feature-configuration-guide_1052/CUCM_BK_C3A84B33_00_cucm-feature-configuration-guide_chapter_0100000.html#CUCM_TK_C11B4F41_00

choices.A: Add the long-distance & international pattern’s partitions to the calling search space of the physical phone.
choices.C: Add the long-distance & international pattern’s partitions to the calling search space of the device phone.
choices.E: Remove long-distance & international pattern’s partitions from the calling search space of the device phone.
choices.B: Remove the long-distance & international pattern’s partitions from the calling search space of the physical phone’s directory number.
choices.D: Add the long-distance & international pattern’s partitions to the calling search space of the physical phone’s directory number.

questions.question_text: An administrator discovers that employees are making unauthorized long-distance and international calls from logged-off Extension Mobility phones when the authorized users are away from their desks. Which two configurations should the administrator configure in the Cisco UCM to avoid this issue? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
Remove the partitions from the Device CSS and Directory CSS

Selected Answer: BC
It's "device profile", not "device phone". The correct question syntax is in question 112.

comments.content:
D & E are correct 
Remove CSS-phone and add CSS-line

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
B and C are correct

comments.content: agree but in C "device phone" must be replaced with "device profile"

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
Some typos in the answers. It's "device profile", not "device phone".

Good refresher here:
https://www.globalknowledge.com/us-en/resources/resource-library/articles/understanding-calling-search-space-usage-at-the-phone-and-line-level/#gref

Selected Answer: BC
Answer B and C

questions.question_text: Which section under the Real-Time Monitoring Tool allows for reviewing the call flow and signaling for a SIP call in real time?

comments.content:
Yes. C is the correct answer. All steps ftom your link:
System > Voice/Video > SIP activity > Session trace log view > Real Time data

discussion.content:
The correct answer is C.
What do you think reading that link?
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/unified-communications/unified-communications-manager-callmanager/213583-procedure-to-analyse-call-flow-of-sip-ca.html

System > Tools > Trace and Log Central >> Real Time Trace > View Real Time Data
shows the Logs as the come in real time.
Voice/Video > Session Trace Log View > Real Time Data
loads saved Logs for selected period (max 60 minutes long) in the past.
I think the correct answer is C. Cisco labs for this course focus on gathering info as described by C.

comments.content: Tested on CUCM: Really B- because in C answer you can see data only after call, but in B you can see the call progress in real-time

I think the most appropriate answer is C . Reason - B (You need to gather the logs and analyze with tools) C (You can view the SIP call flow etc from RTMT itself, no need of any tool to find the call flow and signaling)
Real-Time data in section Voice/Video is located: Voice/Video->Call Process->Session Trace log View

choices.A: Analysis Manager > Inventory > Trace File Repositories
choices.B: System > Tools > Trace and Log Central
choices.C: Voice/Video > Session Trace Log View > Real Time Data
choices.D: Voice/Video > Session Trace Log View > Open From Local Disk

choices.C: The voicemail pilot number is missing from the call handling on Cisco Unity Express.
choices.A: The voicemail pilot number for call forwarding is missing from the ephone-dn.
choices.D: The voicemail pilot number for call forwarding is missing from the ephone.
choices.B: The voicemail pilot number is missing from the telephony service configuration on Cisco UCME.

questions.question_text: Calls to a particular extension are not routing to voicemail. The user reaches the voicemail system from the handset by pressing the Messages button. Which configuration parameter causes this problem?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A appears to be the correct answer here

questions.question_text: An engineer is troubleshooting Cisco Device Mobility and find that the phone has roamed to a building that is assigned to a different device pool but has not changed its device pool accordingly. What action resolves the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
CM > System > 
 - Device Mobility Group > Name
 - Device Mobility Info > Add: Name, IPv4/IPv6 Subnet, Mask, Device Pools: ...

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

choices.A: Set correct Location under Current Device Mobility Settings.
choices.B: Enable SRST under Current Device Mobility Settings.
choices.D: Set the correct subnet under Device Mobility info.
choices.C: Set Device CSS under Current Device Mobility Settings.
